channel.title: Spawn an object and save it?
channel.description: I know theres a bunch of codes out there that show you how to spawn an object in-game, but is it possible that it can transfer into your client.java and be saved, and others can see the object as well once you compile and re-run the server? Or is this not possible? I don't need it, I'm just wondering plus it would be cool to have.

item.title: Spawn an object and save it?
item.dc:creator: @Kalvin Kalvin
item.description:
@Kalvin wrote:

/100% credits to , jayden for this command./

if (command.startsWith("object") && playerRights >= 2) { try { int newObjectID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7)); if (newObjectID >= 0) { makeGlobalObject(absX, absY, newObjectID, heightLevel, 10); sM("You spawn an object"); } else { sM("No such Object"); } } catch(Exception e) { sM("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::object 1"); }}

Read full topic
item.source: Spawn an object and save it?

item.title: Spawn an object and save it?
item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

I can make it for you, just give me the coords and NPC Id if it’s a store I cand do that.

item.title: Spawn an object and save it?
item.dc:creator: @dillingo dillingo
item.description:
@dillingo wrote:

I know theres a bunch of codes out there that show you how to spawn an object in-game, but is it possible that it can transfer into your client.java and be saved, and others can see the object as well once you compile and re-run the server? Or is this not possible?
I don’t need it, I’m just wondering plus it would be cool to have.
